summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in semver 7.5.0 (CVE-2022-25883) causing Regular Expression Denial of Service. The vulnerability was resolved by updating the dependency chain through ts-loader.
userImpact: Applications using this SDK version are vulnerable to Denial of Service attacks via specially crafted semantic version ranges.
rootCause: semver library versions before 7.5.2 have a Regular Expression Denial of Service vulnerability in the Range function when processing untrusted input.
proposedFix: Upgrade semver to version 7.5.2 or later; upgrade ts-loader which transitively depends on semver.
resolutionDetails: The issue was automatically closed by Mend after the vulnerable library was either ignored or removed from the inventory, indicating the dependency was updated or removed from the build.
keyQuote: Versions of the package semver before 7.5.2 are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) via the function new Range
